question.name: Pre_Q1
question.text: To make a DSM-5 diagnosis of PTSD, there are a number of criteria which the patient must meet. These criteria include: intrusion symptoms; avoidance symptoms; negative cognitions or moods associated with the traumatic event; and alterations in arousal or reactivity following the event. From the choices below, which lists examples of “alterations in arousal or reactivity following the event”?
question.choices: a) Flashbacks, recurrent intrusive memories, nightmares.|b) Sleep disturbance, exaggerated startle response, poor concentration.|c) Amnesia for important aspects of the traumatic event, feeling detached or estranged from others, distorted beliefs about the cause or consequences of the event.|d) B and C

question.name: Pre_Q2
question.text: According to the US National Comorbidity Survey (1995), what is the lifetime prevalence of at least one other psychiatric disorder in those suffering from PTSD?

question.name: Pre_Q3
question.text: All of the following are disorders comorbid with PTSD. Which are the most common comorbid disorders reported by those suffering from PTSD?
question.choices: a) Panic Disorder and Borderline Personality Disorder.|b) Dissociative Disorders and Somatization Disorder.|c) Agoraphobia and Generalized Anxiety Disorder.|d) Major Depression and Alcohol Use Disorder.

question.name: Pre_Q4
question.text: Dr. Brown has been seeing Mary - a patient diagnosed with PTSD - for over a year and they have a good working relationship. Mary comes to see Dr. Brown complaining of a lump in her throat. Dr. Brown listens to her complaints and then asks Mary if she would open her mouth so she can “take a look.” Mary does not respond and stares blankly ahead. What should Dr. Brown do?
question.choices: a) Ask Mary if she heard her. |b) Gently put her hand on Mary’s arm and ask Mary if she heard her.|c) Say firmly “Mary, you’re with me, Dr. Brown.”|d) A and C|e) B and C

question.name: Pre_Q5
question.text: What does it mean to “SAVE” the situation?
question.choices: a) share, attend, view, enable|b) sense, apprehend, verify, explain|c) stop, appreciate, validate, explore|d) savour, absorb, venerate, enjoy

question.name: Pre_Q6
question.text: What is the most common reason for self-injury?
question.choices: a) It is a cry for help.|b) To regulate one’s emotions.|c) As a way to resist the urge to commit suicide.|d) To punish one’s self.|e) To get out of a dissociative state.

question.name: Pre_Q7
question.text: Research on pharmacotherapy of PTSD has shown that first-line medication treatment should be:\r
question.choices: a) An atypical antipsychotic|b) An SSRI antidepressant|c) A benzodiazepine|d) An alpha-adrenergic receptor blocker
